div.p: The official URL for this implementation guide is:
FHIR Implementation Guide for Stroke: A Dual Focus on the Patient's Journey and Outcome Measures

title.value: Projeto Molic-AVC: Monitoramento da Linha de Cuidado do AVC

description.value: FHIR Implementation Guide for Stroke: A Dual Focus on the Patient's Journey and Outcome Measures

valueMarkdown.value: Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on HL7 Terminology
Automatically added as a dependency - all IGs depend on the HL7 Extension Pack

description.value: The Encounter Resource in the MOLIC-AVC project represents the actual interaction between a patient and their healthcare provider(s). It's designed to document delivered health services or assess the patient's health status.

Observations are a central element in healthcare, used to support diagnosis, monitor progress, determine baselines and patterns and even capture demographic characteristics, as well as capture results of tests performed on products and substances. Most observations are simple name/value pair assertions with some metadata, but some observations group other observations together logically, or even are multi-component observations.

The Organization resource in the MOLIC-AVC project encompasses all entities or groups involved in the healthcare process and related health services as part of their formal responsibilities. Examples include: Primary Care Basic Health Units, Emergency Care Units, Reference Hospital for Stroke, public ambulance transport (SAMU), private services, and others.
The Patient Resource of the Molic-AVC Project stores demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

The Practitioner Resource in the MOLIC-AVC project encompasses all individuals involved in the healthcare process and related health services as part of their formal responsibilities. This Resource is utilized to assign activities and responsibilities to these individuals. Examples include: doctors, nurses, therapists, receptionists, and so on.

A structured set of questions intended to guide the collection of answers from end-users. Questionnaires provide detailed control over order, presentation, phraseology and grouping to allow coherent, consistent data collection.
QuestionnaireResponse provides a complete or partial list of answers to a set of questions filled when responding to a questionnaire.
One standard drink is equal to 12.5ml of pure alcohol, or roughly 1 small glass of wine/25cl of regular beer (5% alcohol).
Stroke severity: consciousness. Indicate the patient’s level of consciousness measured on hospitalar arrival.
Extension to capture the patient's ethnicity which represents their cultural background or heritage. Although optional, ICHOM strongly encourages collecting this inclusive information.
The patient's gender.
Extension indicating whether a patient lived alone prior to a stroke event based on ICHOM terminology.

name.value: Extension of Patient's Residence Prior to a Stroke

description.value: An extension to capture the patient's residence prior to a stroke event, based on the ICHOM code.

name.value: Extension of Estimated Stroke Severity Category based on NIHSS

description.value: Estimated Stroke Severity: Category. Indicate the estimated stroke severity category by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS).

name.value: Extension of Stroke Severity Score based on NIHSS

description.value: Stroke severity score. Stroke severity as measured by the NIH Stroke Scale (NIHSS). Report the raw (uncategorized) NIHSS score.
Extension to capture the patient's race, as recommended by ICHOM.
The patient's sex at birth.
Extension to capture the patient's smoking status, as recommended by ICHOM.
Brief hours post-symptom onset when prompt intervention reduces brain damage, lasting up to 4.5-12 hours.
Duration of symptoms. Indicate the duration of the stroke symptoms measured on hospital arrival.

name.value: ValueSet of National Registry of Health Establishments (CNES - Cadastro Nacional de Estabelecimentos de Saúde)

description.value: This ValueSet details codes for Stroke Healthcare Units in Joinville based on National Registry of Health Establishments (CNES - Cadastro Nacional de Estabelecimentos de Saúde).
Indicate which comorbidities the patient is living with. Select all conditions that apply at every annual follow-up.

name.value: ValueSet da Base de Evidência Diagnóstica

description.value: Este ValueSet indica qual base de evidência diagnóstica foi utilizada para sua realização.

name.value: ValueSet que categoriza a gravidade estimada do AVC por meio do NIHSS

description.value: Este ValueSet tem por finalidade categorizar a gravidade do AVC baseando-se no National Institute of Health Stroke Scale (NIHSS)
This ValueSet includes the hospital departments responsible for taking care of stroke patients.
This ValueSet details codes for healthcare units serving stroke patients in Brazil.
Discharge destination following acute care hospitalization. What type of place was the patient discharged to?
This ValueSet defines the response values for the EQ-5D-3L Questionnaire.

Patient's Ethnicity captures the cultural background or heritage individuals identify with most closely. It is recorded based on local standards in the geographic region and self-reported by the patient. Although optional, ICHOM strongly encourages collecting this inclusive information to address health disparities while ensuring confidentiality. . Responses are coded using LOINC standards.

name.value: ValueSet of Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status questionnaire

description.value: This ValueSet defines the response values for the Prestroke and Poststroke Functional Status questionnaire.
ValueSet for Gender identity based on LOINC.

name.value: ValueSet of Health-related Quality of Life Response Question

description.value: This ValueSet defines the response values for the Health-related Quality of Life Response Question.
ValueSet indicating whether a patient lived alone prior to a stroke event based on ICHOM terminology.

name.value: ValueSet of Patient's Residence Prior to a Stroke

description.value: Represents the patient's most recent place of residence before the occurrence of a stroke based on ICHOM code.
This ValueSet defines the response values for the PROMIS-10 (Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System 10-item short form) Questionnaire.
Value set for capturing the patient's race based on LOINC standards, as recommended by ICHOM.
Indicate and classify where the patient was referred.
ValueSet for Smoking Status. A person's current and past smoking behavior.
This ValueSet defines the response values for the VR-12 (Veterans RAND 12 Item Health Survey).
This ValueSet defines the response values for the WHODAS (World Health Organization Disability Assessment Schedule) Questionnaire.

name.value: ValueSet of simplified modified Ranking Scale questionnaire (SMRSq)

description.value: This ValueSet defines the response values for the simplified modified Ranking Scale questionnaire.
Valueset com respostas Sim, Não e Desconhecido (yes, no and unknown)
This ValueSet is integral to the Molic-AVC project and details codes for professionals serving stroke patients in Brazil.

name.value: ValueSet que Categoriza o Estado de Consciência

description.value: Este ValueSet indica o estado de consciência do paciente aferido na chegada ao Hospital de Referência.

name.value: ValueSet que categoriza o tipo de AVC

description.value: Este ValueSet tem por finalidade categorizar o tipo do AVC

name.value: ValueSet que categoriza a Duração dos Sintomas do AVC

description.value: ValueSet que categoriza a duração dos sintomas do AVC considerando o início dos sintomas até a admissão no hospital de referência

This case study presents a patient profile tailored for the Molic-AVC project, an initiative focused on optimizing care for Acute Ischemic Stroke patients. The profile extends the FHIR Patient resource with specialized extensions to capture essential data.
